title: Miyuki Yanagita
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. She played for <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a>.
Club career.
Yanagita was born in <a href="Chigasaki%2C%20Kanagawa">Chigasaki</a> on April 11, 1981. When she was a high school student, she played for <a href="Nippon%20TV%20Beleza">NTV Beleza</a>. In 2000, she graduated from high school and she joined <a href="Tasaki%20Perule%20FC">Tasaki Perule FC</a>. In 2006, she moved to <a href="Urawa%20Reds%20Ladies">Urawa Reds</a>. She retired end of 2012 season. She played 239 matches at 3 clubs in <a href="L.League">L.League</a> and she was selected Best Eleven 3 times (<a href="2006%20L.League">2006</a>, <a href="2009%20L.League">2009</a> and <a href="2010%20L.League">2010</a>).
National team career.
In December 1997, when Yanagita was 16 years old, she was selected <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> for <a href="1997%20AFC%20Women%27s%20Championship">1997 AFC Championship</a>. At this competition, on December 5, she debuted and scored a goal against <a href="Guam%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Guam</a>. She was a member of Japan for <a href="1999%20FIFA%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">1999</a>, <a href="2003%20FIFA%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">2003</a>, <a href="2007%20FIFA%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">2007 World Cup</a>, <a href="Football%20at%20the%202004%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20tournament">2004</a> and <a href="Football%20at%20the%202008%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20tournament">2008 Summer Olympics</a>. She played 91 games and scored 11 goals for Japan until 2008.
